title: Around the Districts : Banteer , Kilbrin , Kilshannig and Mourneabbey
body_text:
Around the Districts: Banteer, Kilbrin, Kilshannig and Mourneabbey
BANTEER
Farewell celebration for Fr Winter
A farewell celebration in recognition of Fr Winter 16 years as our Parish Priest is being held on Sunday 15th October at 7pm at The Glen Theatre. All are very welcome. Any enquiries Contact John Joe Roche 0876995471, James Twohig 0872128589.
Foroige
Banteer/Lyre Foroige reopens on Friday the 13th Oct in Banteer Community Centre at 8pm. Open to all secondary students. Any queries contact Eileen at 0861037039 or Maria at 0872822847.
Sportsfield welcome funding
Banteer Community Sportsfield welcome SSE Renewables Coomacheo & Curragh wind farms funding award this week to Banteer Community Sportsfield Ltd. A total of €7,049 funding has been awarded for energy improvements including water heating and energy efficient lighting at Banteer Community Sportdsdfield. The presentation evening will take place in early October in the Halla Baile Mhúirne, Baile Mhúirne , Co Chorcaí
Glen Theatre Banteer
Autumn Winter Programme – Sunday 8th October: Gerry Guthrie and full band in concert. Friday 13th October: Johnny McEvoy. Friday 27th October: A night at the Theatre with Groucho. Glen Theatre Banteer Drama group-one act Festival dates to be finalised for October. Saturday 2nd December: Ultan Conlon and Mary Coughlan. Friday 8th December: Robert Mizzell Christmas Concert. All shows start 8pm sharp. Booking 029 56239 or 087 7558752.
Banteer Bingo
Bingo is played at Banteer Community Centre on Tuesday night at 8:30, playing for jackpot of €5,400. Looking forward to seeing everyone.
Community Sportsfield/Park
Please support your local Café, open Wednesday, Thursday and Fridays 10am till 2pm for granola pots, selection of toasties, sandwiches to go, ice creams, scones, treats and coffees. Also opened on Mon Tues Weds Thurs Fri evenings from 6pm to 8.30pm. Any volunteers who wish to help in café please contact Denis Withers 087 2820001.
Banteer Macra
New members can sign up online or contact our social media for info. We competed in the regional football competition and both our men’s and women’s teams are now through to the national final on 22nd October
A four week jiving course beginning Friday 6th October in Lyre hall. No partner or experience required. Guaranteed to be lots of fun for everyone involved.
Sportsfield/Park draw
Banteer Sportsfield/Park draw for 2023 tickets available from members please support same as your support keeps us going and helps us make it better for all users. Next draw in October.
KILBRIN
Kilbrin Ploughing Association
The Kilbrin Ploughing Association will hold will hold their Annual Ploughing match on this Sunday 8th October, on the lands of Patrick Ahern Ballyclough, by kind permission. Ploughing will commence at 11 O Clock. All entries to Willie Stokes at 087 2672910.
Fashion Show
We are delighted to see the return of our Glitz & Glamour fashion show on Friday 20th of October.
This is always a fantastic night out and so well supported by local business. Such a great venue at Kilbrin Community Social Club with plenty space and comfortable surroundings.
Mary Corkery’s efforts to organise this in aid of 2 wonderful charities are incredible. Mary is supported by lots of other helpers in getting this event organised. Alzheimers support and suicide prevention are the benefiting charities.
Lots of amazing stand holders will be displaying their selection of crafts on the night. See you all there.
Designs by Jennifer Jones, Lady Lydia, Swear By Fashion Dunnes Stores. For tickets contact Beatrice Daly 0879547757 or Claire Buttimer 0877833636
Christmas Fair
Sunday 10th of Decemeber. Hurry hurry...only 3 Tables left! So far we have a Great selection of crafts, timber products, crochet, knitting, baby clothes, Xmas decorations, home baking, hot drinks, sweet treats, jewellery. Surprise for the children in store too!! Please Contact Pat for more information on 0878157741.
Bingo
Please join us every Monday night in the Social club bar and hall for a great night of Bingo. It starts at 8.30 sharp. Everyone is always welcome to join. Bar/tea/coffee/sweets and treats available and all in a very comfortable warm environment. This fun activity is suitable for all ages and is the main fundraiser to keep our Community Centre alive so we would appeal to all near and far to come and support. It is greatly appreciated. The jackpot is now at €1200 on 47 calls!
Croke Rovers
Huge congratulations to the U15 footballers that beat Kilshannig in the final last Sunday morning in Banteer Astro. It was nail biting stuff from start to finish but our boys came out on top and beat their opponents by 5 points. Fantastic win for them and we wish them all the best in the County championship going forward.
We have no doubt there will be more shiny cups to follow in the future. Well done again boys.
Basketball
Brilliant Super Sunday of basketball had by the ladies U14’s and 16s where they had home game wins against opponents Carrigaline. Great start made to the league. Best of luck in the future games. Well done to local girl Anina-May Cremin who plays with U14’s.
Also the Boys U10s team had a fantastic day in the Parochial hall playing a blitz against Blue Demons and Fr. Matthews. Brilliant display of skill from our local boys Fionn Corkery, Reid Casey, Donncha Cremin and James O Sullivan. Well done lads!
Huge thanks to Ladies U14 coach Keith Cremin and Boys U10 coach Clodagh Corkery.
Social Club
Well done to Catherine O’Sullivan who won the first Bonus ball House Draw.
If you would like a chance to win all you have to do is pay €2 per line. Bonus ball draw on Saturday nights irish lotto. If all are sold winner takes all with a maximum of 47 numbers and €94.00 up for grabs.
If the winning number is not sold on the sheet it rolls over to the following week. All details in the club bar. This draw is for the customers only.
Kids Halloween Disco
The ever popular kids disco will be held on Friday 27th October in the hall from 7-9pm. Plenty treats and sweets and glow sticks. Fun games for the children and prizes to be won!! Full shop on site too..
Adults Halloween Party
It’s back, the Adults Halloween Party!! Venue: Kilbrin Social Club, When?? Sunday 30th October. Huge prize of €250 to be won for Best Dressed/Costume! Not to be missed...
Kilbrin GAA
Lotto: Our lotto draw took place on Wednesday night last for a jackpot of €15,500. Results will be published in next week’s notes.
Castlecor Potatoes JAFC Semi-final: On Tuesday evening last our footballers took on our near neighbours and great rivals in the semi final of the JAFC. Results will be on next week’s notes.
Community Council
We are delighted to recently have works completed at the Kilbrin Community sports and social club to improve ventilation and preventive measures to correct the ongoing dampness issues.
We had our building reviewed by Damp master and they identified a lot of contributing factors to our dampness and roof leaks. They identified a water leak along the ceiling at the adjoining building roof, Plaster corroded in the ceiling roof area, water entry along the wall as a result, Expanding foam under the metal not doing as expected in this area. high humidity levels & mould spores found along the wals ceiling through out the building.
Our community council worked closely with Damp master to have all areas sealed up where water was getting in , ventilation systems installed throughout the building in most rooms to ensure no more dampness, Professional cleaning and removal of all mould on walls and ceiling through the building.
Of course all this much needed work could not have been possible with the generous support of Cork Country Council and their funding through the Amenity/Capital/Community Contract of 50%.
We are very grateful as a community for this support from Cork County Council that allows rural community facilities to be maintained.
KILSHANNIG
Kilshannig Heritage Society
This Sunday October 8th at 12.30pm we will be launching our website and a historic map of Kilshannig Parish in the GAA complex in Glantane and all are welcome.
Mayor of County Cork Frank O’Flynn will do the honours. A number of people will display artefacts, heirlooms, photos etc on what will resemble a pop up museum and light refreshments will also be served.
This will be a good opportunity for the communities in the parish to come together on a joyful occasion and anybody with artefacts are asked to bring them along.
Set Dancingr at Laharn Heritage Centre
Set Dancing classes returned at Laharn Heritage Centre (Eircode: P51FK44) on Wednesday 4th October. Classes will be for 8 weeks from 8pm–9.30pm each night. Cost for term of 8 weeks is €50. We look forward to getting back dancing!
MOURNEABBEY
Clyda Rovers GAA
Lotto - Result for 29th September. Jackpot €12,500. Numbers: 13, 27, 30 & 32. No Winner. €20 Ann Bradford, Ballyphilibeen; €20 Cathal O’Riordan, Lahakineen; €20 Eilish Nugent, Island; €20 Ollie O’Hanlon, Monaparson; €20 Fergal Cronin, Ballyhillogue.
Fixtures next week - Our Junior C Hurlers will be playing the final v Newtownshandrum next weekend. Venur and time TBC so keep an eye out on social media re the fixture details. Best of luck to the management and team
Healthy Clubs: Heart Screening - AMS (Advanced Medical Services) will hold a day of Cardiac Screening at MourneAbbey Community Centra on Saturday Nov 4th from 9.30pm to 5pm. It is open to anyone 12 years or over and it is to help prevent Sudden Adult Death Syndrome. It takes about 20 mins and It’s free to Laya Healthcare Members, otherwise it’s €79. To book a slot, use the link on our twitter account or else login to www.ameds.ie and enter clinic code mourneabbey
Juvenile notes - Clyda U13 Football Final: St Dominics 6-7 Clyda 1-10 Last Saturday Clyda played St Dominics in the U13 Football Final. Disappointing scenes before the start of the game in Doneraile as 4 teams scheduled to play and only one pitch playable. Following a coin toss to see who would play the Clyda boys started the game well. Weather conditions were poor but Clyda led 1-6 to 0-5 at half time. St Dominic’s scored a goal at the start of the second half. At the end of the third quarter St Dominic’s led by 3-7 to 1-10.
The turning point in the game came when after a good move a goal bound effort from Clyda hit the crossbar and came back into the play and the resulting Dominic’s attack led to a penalty being conceded. Dominics scored the resultant penalty and scored two more late goals as Clyda poured in search of scores. Clyda Scores: J Ring 1-6 R O Mullane 0-3 T Colton 0-1
Our U-15 Hurlers played Banteer/lyre in the Division 3 championship Cup final in Mallow last week, Final score Clyda 3-06 Banteer 5-14
Our U-17 has had played Millstreet in both Football and hurling championship Semi finals in the last week emerging victorious in both matches by a single point. we will be playing Kilshannig in both finals over the next two weeks.
Also, our U-12 has had a great season fresh from winning against Kilworth in their last match reaching the Football Cup final against a strong Mallow side in Castletownroche last Sunday, Final score Clyda 1-07 Mallow 6-07.
Mourneabbey Community Council
The community of Mourneabbey are beyond sad at the passing of our Rep from Burnfort/Greenhill Brian Deane. Brian was an absolute gentleman, and always had a kind word to say to all. He was a great community man and was a valued member of the community council. We express our sympathies to all of Brians family.
